entries.name: avail_in()
entries.desc: Returns bytes of data in the input buffer. Normally, returns 0.

entries.name: avail_out()
entries.desc: Returns number of bytes of free spaces in output buffer.  Because the free space is allocated automatically, this method returns 0 normally.

entries.name: avail_out=(p1)
entries.desc: Allocates size bytes of free space in the output buffer. If there are more than size bytes already in the buffer, the buffer is truncated. Because free space is allocated automatically, you usually don't need to use this method.

entries.name: close()
entries.desc: Closes the stream. All operations on the closed stream will raise an exception.

entries.name: closed?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is closed.

entries.name: data_type()
entries.desc: Guesses the type of the data which have been inputed into the stream. The returned value is either BINARY, ASCII, or UNKNOWN.

entries.name: end()
entries.desc: Closes the stream. All operations on the closed stream will raise an exception.

entries.name: ended?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is closed.

entries.name: finished?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is finished.

entries.name: reset()
entries.desc: Resets and initializes the stream. All data in both input and output buffer are discarded.

entries.name: stream_end?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the stream is finished.

entries.name: total_in()
entries.desc: Returns the total bytes of the input data to the stream.  FIXME

entries.name: total_out()
entries.desc: Returns the total bytes of the output data from the stream.  FIXME
